content:
I'm happy to help!

Mastering kanji can be a challenging but rewarding part of learning Japanese. Here are some popular apps that can help you practice reading kanji:

**1. Anki** (Web, iOS, Android) - A spaced repetition flashcard app that's highly customizable. You can create your own decks or download pre-made ones, including kanji decks.

**2. Tofugu's WaniKani** (Web, iOS, Android) - A comprehensive kanji learning platform that uses mnemonics, radicals, and spaced repetition to help you learn and remember kanji.

**3. Kanji Study** (iOS, Android) - A dedicated kanji learning app with a large database of characters, stroke orders, and example sentences.

**4. Memrise** (Web, iOS, Android) - A popular language learning app that includes a large kanji course with user-generated content and spaced repetition.

**5. Joyo Kanji** (iOS, Android) - A free app that focuses on the Joyo kanji, which are the standardized set of kanji characters used in everyday Japanese writing.

**6. KanjiQ** (iOS) - A simple, gamified app that quizzes you on kanji readings and meanings.

**7. Learn Japanese with Yomiwa** (iOS, Android) - A comprehensive Japanese learning app that includes a kanji dictionary, flashcards, and practice exercises.

**8. Kanji Grid** (Android) - A unique app that helps you practice kanji readings by filling in a grid of characters.

**9. Kanji Senpai** (iOS) - A free app that offers a large kanji database, flashcards, and practice exercises.

**10. NHK WORLD-JAPAN's Kanji Master** (Web) - A free online tool provided by Japan's national public broadcasting organization, featuring interactive kanji lessons and exercises.

These apps can be a great supplement to your Japanese language studies. Consistency is key, so try to set aside time each day to practice reading kanji. Good luck, and (ganbare) - good luck with your studies!
